data.title: BENTON COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY
data.meta_description:
Our mission is to connect our community by preserving and sharing its diverse, evolving stories through history, culture, and art.
We achieve this throu...
data.text:
The Philomath College Building (1867) is our headquarters, the Philomath Museum, and is on the National Register of Historic Places. We will be writing a Master Plan for the Philomath Museum, re-visioning how we use the spaces in and around the building with an emphasis on historic preservation, accessibility, and education.

The Philomath Museum has two galleries: the Moreland Gallery, in which we showcase exhibitions featuring local and regional artists, and the History Gallery is used for exhibitions showcasing artifacts from our collection.

We hold a number of education programs throughout the year including lectures, school field trips, and our Free Family Day event. We also partner with Maxtivity, a local arts organization, to host art-based summer camps.

The collection of BCHS includes approximately 140,000 artifacts, many of which focus on Benton County history. In the mid-2000s we acquired the collection of the Horner Museum, which was part of Oregon State University.

Population(s) Served

Adults

Children and youth

The Corvallis Museum opened in 2021 in a new LEED-certified building designed by Allied Works Architecture. Permanent and rotating exhibitions showcase our collection of over 140,000 objects which include regional artifacts and art as well as international objects and natural history specimens from the former Horner Museum at Oregon State University.

We hold a number of education programs throughout the year including lectures, school field trips, and our Free Family Day event. We also partner with The Arts Center, Cornerstone Associates, and Casa Latinos Unidos to create targeted programming to serve a variety of audiences.

Population(s) Served

Adults

Children and youth
